error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'String'.
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Boolean'. Did you mean 'boolean'?
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Number'. Did you mean 'number'?
error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Object'. Did you mean 'object'?
privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts(7,17): error TS2584: Cannot find name 'console'. Do you need to change your target library? Try changing the 'lib' compiler option to include 'dom'.
privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts(7,31): error TS18014: The property '#x' cannot be accessed on type 'Base' within this class because it is shadowed by another private identifier with the same spelling.
privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts(10,17): error TS2584: Cannot find name 'console'. Do you need to change your target library? Try changing the 'lib' compiler option to include 'dom'.


!!! error TS2318: Cannot find global type 'Array'.

!!! error TS2552: Cannot find name 'Object'. Did you mean 'object'?
==== privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts (3 errors) ====
    class Base {
        #x;
        constructor() {
            class Derived {
                #x;
                testBase(x: Base) {
                    console.log(x.#x);
                    ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2584: Cannot find name 'console'. Do you need to change your target library? Try changing the 'lib' compiler option to include 'dom'.
                                  ~~
!!! error TS18014: The property '#x' cannot be accessed on type 'Base' within this class because it is shadowed by another private identifier with the same spelling.
!!! related TS18017 privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts:5:13: The shadowing declaration of '#x' is defined here
!!! related TS18018 privateNameNestedClassFieldShadowing.ts:2:5: The declaration of '#x' that you probably intended to use is defined here
                }
                testDerived(x: Derived) {
                    console.log(x.#x);
                    ~~~~~~~
!!! error TS2584: Cannot find name 'console'. Do you need to change your target library? Try changing the 'lib' compiler option to include 'dom'.
                }
            }
        }
    }
